posts.content:
This is my first post to the forum and is a fairly pointless one as a lot of what has happened is my own fault. In 2002 I left my 63 Samba deluxe with a specialist near Colchester for some restoration work. I was moving to Spain and was in no hurry to have it finished. I was thinking up to a year would not be a problem.
It was finally ready late last year!
I had delivered it as a bodyshell with the parts in various plastic crates etc. When I collected it with the crates they were a lot emptier than they should have been.
I lost the following:

Dudley foldaway hob/grill
Easicool fridge
All table legs
Jail bars
Hubcaps
Deluxe bumper trim
Rear bumper
Original towbar
Original keys
Chrome speedo surround
Bullit indicator surrounds
Spare wheel

This is what I can see at the moment but as I am just starting to restore the interior and re-fit it I may find more. I know this is all after the event and whats done is done but I wanted to get it off my chest, there I feel so much better.

Scratch that last line, I have been flicking around the Devon section and seeing all the complete interiors and spotting the same model of cooker etc. has got me all riled.
My things were with my van for the best part of 50 years and somebody decided that their need was greater than mine.

Still not feeling better

So you left your van for 10 years with a restorer, left the country, and have discovered things are missing. Thats a shame, but it makes it difficult to pinpoint when things actually went missing. Do you have any pics of the missing items.

As I said at the start, it is my own fault. I trustrd the guy who owned the business but did not allow for the large turnover of people that worked for him, all of whom would have been fans of the marque.
The cooker was there a few weeks before I collected the van as I saw it in one of the boxes. Most of the other stuff was there as well although I did not do a complete inventory.
I reakon it was one person who worked there last year.
Pictures no, but I have seen a picture of the same model of cooker on this site, green and black foldaway Dudley.

I know I am a prat for leaving it in another country for 9 years and hindsight is a wonderful thing and if I had had the time and the money I would have done things differently.
Post some pics up on here, it will give us a chance to keep an eye out.
